column2: For the crust:Butter your cake pan.Combine the crumbs, sugar and salt together in a =bowl. Pour over the melted butter and stir. Pat a layer of crumbs along the bottom of the cake pan and about halfway up the sides.Bake for 10 minutes at 180°C / 360°F.For the cheesecake: Put a kettle of water on to boil.Beat the cream cheese until it is soft and creamy. Add the sugar and salt and continue to beat until the cream cheese is light. Add the vanilla and the eggs, one by one. Add the heavy cream or the sour cream and stir.Pour over the crust and bake in the oven at 160°C / 320°F for 1 1/2 hours. Then, turn off the heat but leave the cheesecake in the oven in its bain-marie for 1 hour.Place in the fridge for at least 4 hours.For the salted caramel sauce:In a saucepan, bring the water to the boil. Add the sugar and stir until the mixture turns golden brown. Off the heat add the butter, then the salt. Stir.In a different saucepan, bring the heavy cream to the boil. Add it to the caramel, stirring constantly. Let it simmer on low heat for 3 minutes.Serve the cheesecake with this salted caramel sauce on top.

In a bowl, prepare the frangipane by mixing marzipan, sugar and butter.After preparation gets well mixed, add the rum.In a pie plate, place the dough. Cut the apple into thin slices and arrange on the dough.Then place the frangipane and coat with the second pastry.Using the back of a knife, make a decoration on top and brush with the egg yolk.Place in the oven thermostat 7 (210°C/ 410°F) for 30-40 minutes.

Sauté chicken over a medium heat until golden brown.Meanwhile, peel and cut vegetables: Slice onions and quarter apples.Add vegetables to chicken then add tajine spices and cumin.Add some water (3/4 of a glass).Cook for about 1 hour.
